c4p.brief: GDG DevFest Ukraine was announced, for the sixth year in a row, the conference will bring together 900 developers, managers and...
c4p.content:
GDG DevFest Ukraine was announced, for the sixth year in a row, the conference will bring together 900 developers, managers and entrepreneurs on **October 13-14** to Lviv. This year our team is doing big advancement in the content, we're building an extra stage to accommodate more visitors and provide three fully independent tracks on Android, Web and Google Cloud topics. Our focus is the content. **We‚Äôre looking for speakers like you**, who are ready to rock the stage and deliver the best talk or workshop in the field. "I've been to conferences all over the world and what you've created in Lviv is world class. It's easily first league of conferences." - Piotr Tuszynski, DevFest '16 Keynote Speaker
Submit a proposal
## Why is it cool to speak at the DevFest? DevFest Ukraine is not an ordinary tech conference, besides selecting only the best speakers, we help them to succeed in delivering an exceptional quality talk on the stage. Here are few perks that all our speakers get: - **Expences covered**. Hotel for 3 nights, travel costs and entrance to exclusive speaker parties are covered for all speakers. - **Professional video recording**. We work with experienced video production companies to create session recording of the best quality. Stage, screen, audio, all is recorded separately and combined later. Check the [session videos from the last year](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VOwUnBkqmo4). - **Exposure**. By being a speaker, you are proving your level of expertise to a potential business partners or employers. Your talk will be promoted in our online resources and recording published in YouTube channel with more than 35k views. - **Unique networking**. Being a speaker means you‚Äôll have the unique chance to network with other speakers - the best experts in the industry. - **Coaching**. We're in the same boat, after being selected as a speaker our program committee will help you to deliver the best talk possible. We provide information about the audience, presentation templates, feedback on the slides, all to help you to prepare. "It was a best DevFest I ever attended. So professional, so much enthusiasm from the community. You managed to bring the vibe of Google I/O to Ukraine." - David V√°vra, DevFest '16 Speaker ## What are we looking for? We're looking for **experience-based talks**, the information that can not be found in the documentation or easily googled. We're looking for your stories, your struggles, research results and experiences with the frontier tools or technologies. Check the [list of topics](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18eGvBr6wdlXsfiZM4EK6SubfL3G1RWj-ABTBN9pngNg/edit?usp=sharing) we're interested in (it is not full and updated all the time). ### Format You can submit as many talks as you want. This year we accept submissions in two formats: - 40 minutes sessions. - 2(or 3) hours workshops. ### Talks that will not pass initial review - Talks about a specific tool/library/project explaining how it works or how to use it. - Talks whose focus is pitching a company or project. It‚Äôs cool that you mention your company during the presentation, but it shouldn‚Äôt be the focus of the talk. - Proposals that are not in English. - Recruitment talks to attract talent. We strongly recommend you check out [speaking.io](http://speaking.io/) website from Zach Holman. It includes good tips and guidelines for speakers. ## Timeline **Call for Papers submission deadline is July 1, 2017.** Submission results will be announced by July 16. Any questions? Email organizers at [devfest@gdg.org.ua](mailto:devfest@gdg.org.ua)
Submit a proposal
c4p.title: We're looking for speakers

101.description:
En esta charla hablaremos de c√≥mo crear una arquitectura para una aplicaci√≥n Android que utilize los principios de ReactX, ModelView en el lenguaje de programaci√≥n Kotlin.
Vamos a tratar los siguientes temas:
-Kotlin
-ReactX
-ViewModel
-Retrofit
101.title: Capa de Red en Android usando Kotlin + ReactX + ViewModel

102.description: Los sistemas desplegados en la nube deben seguir algunas consideraciones de dise√±o y arquitectura, que garanticen su correcto funcionamiento y mantenimiento, adem√°s de que optimicen costos y recursos. Esta charla pretende introducir las consideraciones m√°s importantes de arquitectura para estos sistemas, y los mecanismos que ofrece Google Cloud para implementarlas.
102.title: Arquitectura para sistemas en la nube con Google Cloud

103.description: Una muestra de como se puede realizar un proceso autom√°tico de despliegue de aplicaciones  con las herramientas de GCP
103.title: CI/CD con GCP

104.description: En varias ocasiones nos ha tocado crear tareas que se ejecuten en segundo plano en Android, para ello hemos creado desde servicios, pasando por JobScheduler hasta usando AlarmManager. Sin embargo cada soluci√≥n ha tenido un problema o restricci√≥n que no ha llegado a una satisfacci√≥n por completa. Es pos eso que el equipo de Android de Google lanzo este a√±o el Workmanager  un componente de arquitectura que hace parte del Android Jetpack el cual permite ejecutar tareas en background de forma segura y robusta. En esta conferencia hablaremos de las soluciones actuales y como pasar a workmanager conociendo sus beneficios y flexibilidad.
104.title: Tareas en background  en Android de formar robusta con el WorkManager

107.description: Una charla acerca de lo √∫ltimo en PWA, lo que se habl√≥ de ellas en el Google I/O y un vistazo al soporte general
107.title: Aplicaciones Web Progresivas (PWA) - Y eso con qu√© se come?

109.description:
Aprende a escribir aplicaciones mantenibles en Angular independientemente del tama√±o de tu equipo y su complejidad, utilizando los mejores consejos de dise√±o de architecturas.
Est√°s en medio de una pesadilla cuando abres un proyecto legado y de repente los tabs y los espacios se encuentran un mismo archivo, los m√≥dulos son importados en todas partes y los singletons no son compartidos.
En estos casos necesitas un est√°ndar: Un protocolo bien definido sobre c√≥mo escribir tu c√≥digo enmarcado en una arquitectura.
En esta charla aprender√°s a:
-Manejar el crecimiento de tu base de c√≥digo de manera eficiente
-Usar las mejores pr√°cticas en m√≥dulos
-Nombrar las variables de manera correcta
-Gestionar el estado de tu aplicaci√≥n efectivamente
Escalar tu estructura de carpetas
Imponer est√°ndares de c√≥digo
Reutilizar tu c√≥digo al m√°ximo
109.title: Scalable Angular Architectures

110.description: Una muestra de como se puede realizar un proceso autom√°tico de despliegue de aplicaciones  con las herramientas de GCP
110.title: CI/CD con GCP

112.description: El futuro de la web y las aplicaciones son las Aplicaciones Web Progresivas
112.title: Progressive Web Applications - The new web

114.description: Conoce el sistema de navegaci√≥n de google maps para android en tiempo real con firebase. Aprende a crear una aplicaci√≥n como Uber o Rappi.
114.title: Sistema de navegacion en tiempo real

500.description: Make sure you won't miss closing ceremony, all gifts from out sponsors and partners will find their owners during this session.
500.title: Conference closing and contest winners announcements

andres_gonzales.bio: Full Stack Web and Mobile developer specialized in Python/Django for backend and HTML5/CSS3, AngularJS for the front-end. Andres has worked in the design, architecture, implementation and deployment of custom solutions using Python/Django with great results. Obsessed for the performance of the applications by using the right technologies and following the best practices. Involved in the architecture of different projects where I have integrated Vagrant, Docker, Jenkins and Amazon Web Services in order to setup TDD and Continuous integration. Experience in CMS development for Wordpress and Drupal. Able to extend the core functionalities, creating custom plugins/modules and themes or integrate them with other services or applications. Love to work in teams using Agile Methodologies and ready to new challenges and learn every day more. Specialties: Web Development, server architecture,mobile development, robotics, entrepreneurship.
andres_gonzales.name: Andres Gonzales

andres_gonzales.title: Ingeniero de sistemas

frank_nicols.bio: Frank Nicols es un joven Administrador de empresas, naci√≥ el 6 de mayo en 1988, en la ciudad de Cali, Colombia. Apasionado por el mundo de la ilusi√≥n y su fuerte es la Magia de gran impacto para eventos corporativos, con una trayectoria de m√°s de 16 a√±os, este hobby que comenz√≥ a los 9 a√±os se convirti√≥ en una pasi√≥n desbordante que brota por sus venas. Ha sido nominado a los premios ‚ÄúTiempo Real TV‚Äù del canal Telepacifico como ‚ÄúMejor perfil art√≠stico en el 2008‚Äù. Ganador del campeonato ‚ÄúNoches de Magia‚Äù llevado a cabo en Medell√≠n en el 2009, categor√≠a Close ‚Äì Up. Es socio fundador de la asociaci√≥n de Magos de Cali y vicepresidente hasta el 2010. Participo en ‚ÄúColombia tiene Talento‚Äù, reality del canal RCN. Represento a Colombia en el primer festival Mundial de Magia en Cali 2013 y este 2014 vuelve a este gran festival como invitado de Colombia.

juan_guillermo_gomez.bio: Juan Guillermo is the co-organizer of several local events, such as GDG Cali, startup weekend Colombia and free software. He has been involved in the tech community for the past 6 years. He attends more than 10 events per year as a guest speaker throughout Latin America, where he speaks about mobile, cloud, firebase, entrepreneurship and innovation. In 2016, he co-founded the first hacker school in Cali (DevHack), where he teaches programming different technologies such as front-end, mobile and back-end. He was the CTO and co-founder of lead IS consulting, where he has developed and deployed enterprise software and mobile applications on Cloud Computing Platforms. He is an educator at DevHack and several Universities at Cali, Colombia. Juan is GDE (Google Developer Expert) in Firebase, holds a BS in System Engineering and a MS in Software Engineering at Universidad San Buenaventura Cali.
juan_guillermo_gomez.name: Juan Guillermo Gomez
